data.title: lonely romantic vampire boy
data.meta_description: Musical video & audios trades including Broadway, West End, Vienna, various European and Asian musicals.
data.text:
I do have more MP4s than I do VOBs. I personally prefer MP4 files as while i know VOBs can be played on VLC, they rarely ever work for me. It's an awkward file type for me and the main media player I use is not VLC as VLC glitches all the time on my computer. Also MP4s are often higher video quality, I have many 1080p and 720p HD MP4s. That does not mean I don't like getting VOBs or reject VOBs.Some traders get put off because I have MP4s so if that puts you off, turn away now. I also mostly have MP3 audios because MP3s can play on pretty much any device and FLACs do not pay on some of the hardware I use.If the video has any sort of watermark, glitching, parts that are audio only, or are incomplete this is mentioned in the blue text under the date, as well as if there are any subtitles embedded or as a separate file and what resolution and file type the video is. All my VOBs have the smalls included unless stated otherwise.I list all dates year/month/day because I'm from the UK where we write day/month/year but that often confuses American traders so for less confusion every date on here is written year/month/day. Musicals are listed alphabetically excluding the word 'The' ('Le' for French musicals, 'Der/Die' for German musicals)

Elisabeth das Musical Videos (104)

Complete MP4. 360p resolution.

I do have more MP4s than I do VOBs. I personally prefer MP4 files as while i know VOBs can be played on VLC, they rarely ever work for me. It's an awkward file type for me and the main media player I use is not VLC as VLC glitches all the time on my computer. Also MP4s are often higher video quality, I have many 1080p and 720p HD MP4s. That does not mean I don't like getting VOBs or reject VOBs.Some traders get put off because I have MP4s so if that puts you off, turn away now. I also mostly have MP3 audios because MP3s can play on pretty much any device and FLACs do not pay on some of the hardware I use.If the video has any sort of watermark, glitching, parts that are audio only, or are incomplete this is mentioned in the blue text under the date, as well as if there are any subtitles embedded or as a separate file and what resolution and file type the video is. All my VOBs have the smalls included unless stated otherwise.I list all dates year/month/day because I'm from the UK where we write day/month/year but that often confuses American traders so for less confusion every date on here is written year/month/day. Musicals are listed alphabetically excluding the word 'The' ('Le' for French musicals, 'Der/Die' for German musicals)
